repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Maude Brown attended Trinity College in Durham, NC from 1924-1926, before transferring to UNC-Chapel Hill. She remained active in Duke's campus life through 1928. The scrapbook includes clippings, photos and memorabilia related to social and academic life at Duke, the Y.W.C.A., May Day celebrations, and occasional trips. The scrapbook ranges in date from 1924-1937.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Maude Brown scrapbook, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Maude Brown scrapbook was received by the University Archives as a gift in 1996.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession A96-130 is described in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Originally from Hillsborough, NC, Maude Turner Brown enrolled at Duke's Woman's College in 1924. She served as a Junior Big Sister and was active in the Y.W.C.A., serving as the Sophomore Representative. She was a fan of Duke's football and baseball teams and of its musical organizations. She attended summer school at Duke in 1926. Soon after her sophomore year, she transferred to the University of NC-Chapel Hill.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains photographs, clippings from the Chanticleer, autograph pages, correspondence, event programs, May Day and Y.W.C.A. memorabilia, sports schedules, class schedules, holiday cards, news clippings, postcards and photos from trips to Chicago and Virginia. Two non-University programs from the 1930s appear towards the end of the book. The scrapbook ranges in date from 1924-1937.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: Brown included these items in a 36-page, string-bound patent "Memory Book of College Life," with Duke's seal on the cover. The scrapbook focuses especially on Brown's life during 1924-1926 and on the general experiences of freshmen and sophomores at Trinity College. Loose items were placed in sleeves and protective sheets between pages containing three dimensional items, for preservation.

controlaccess.subject: Women college students -- North Carolina -- Durham

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This scrapbook contains memorabilia from social and academic events at Trinity College from 1924 to 1928. Included are: photographs, correspondence, report cards, a demerit card for smoking, class schedules, Y.W.C.A. correspondence and memorabilia, musical event programs, holiday cards and clippings related to campus locations and events. Arranged approximately by date (in original page order).
